donor_name: SYR THE MINISTRY OF LOCAL ADMINISTRATION AND ENVIRONMENT
outputs.output_descr: The Regional Planning Commission is a newly established public entity responsible for the framework of the regional planning in Syria. The project provides technical assistance in the field of participatory planning mechanisms and good governance to Regional Planning Commission and related directorates in the 14 governorates. It also ensures proper linkages with the Decentralized Cooperation partners from European local authorities in terms of exchange of experience and knowledge sharing.

donor_name: SYR THE MINISTRY OF LOCAL ADMINISTRATION AND ENVIRONMENT
outputs.output_descr: Emergency support for restoration of disrupted livelihoods

Al Raqqa is located in the North Eastern part of the country and is considered one of the most impoversihed governorates in Syria. The project supports the Governorate in advancing human development and achieving the MDGs, particularly in the target villages. It ensures the engagement of the local communities in the development planning processes and involves youths and women as main actors in the development mechanism. Territorial development planning is considered one of the main tools to maximize the benefits from the local resources and transfrom them into tangible development projects to advance the human development.

Empowering youths to become active citizens and actors of change is the main objective of this project. Through their active participation and civic engagement, youths can be involved in the community development processes in their villages and better understand the needs and challenges. On the other hand, local authorities capacities to develop pro-poor gender sensitive development plans is improved through trainings and hands-on experience, taking into consideration the good governance elements. Local development initiatives promoting for youths civic engagement and improvement of vulnerable groups living conditions are to be implemented.
